info.title: VA Mobile API
info.description: The Department of Veterans Affairs mobile API. All paths are relative to https://api.va.gov/mobile.

get.description: Returns a welcome message.

post.description: Returns urls for app use based on app build number, environment, and OS

get.description: Returns info on all user's claims and appeals for the mobile overview page. Should be identical to the following docs https://developer.va.gov/explore/api/appeals-status/docs?version=current

parameters.description: Appeal Id
parameters.name: id

get.description: Given a date range returns a list of upcoming VA, Community Care, and Express Care appointments. If start and end date ranges are not passed in then it defaults to - 1 year and + 1 year from the beginning of today's UTC date. Requesting a page out of bounds will return an empty list.

parameters.description: The start date for the range of appointments in ISO 8601 UTC format
parameters.name: startDate

parameters.description: The end date for the range of appointments in ISO 8601 UTC format
parameters.name: endDate

parameters.description: The page number requested. Defaults to 1.
parameters.name: page[number]

parameters.description: The number of records to return per page. Defaults to 10.
parameters.name: page[size]

parameters.description: Whether or not to use this API's cache or fetch records from the upstream service
parameters.name: useCache

parameters.description: Field to sort the appointments list by. Currently only supports `startDateUtc`. Prefixing `-` reverses the sort.
parameters.name: sort

parameters.description: Field to include pending appointments or to append Travel Pay claims. Supports value `pending` or `travel_pay_claims`. Redundant with field `included[]` for backwards compatibility but `include` is the correct one to use when following conventions.
parameters.name: include[]

parameters.description: Field to include pending appointments or to append Travel Pay claims. Supports value `pending` or `travel_pay_claims`. Redundant with field `included[]` for backwards compatibility but `include` is the correct one to use when following conventions.
parameters.name: included[]

attributes.comment: Please arrive 20 minutes before the start of your appointment
Please arrive 20 minutes before the start of your appointment
Please log on 5 minutes before the start of your appointment
Please log on 5 minutes before the start of your appointment

Partial Appointments.description: For cases when 1 or more errors are returned from upstream, an error message with source `VA Service` is added within the meta

attributes.comment: Please arrive 20 minutes before the start of your appointment

errors.title: Forbidden
errors.detail: You do not have access to online scheduling

put.description: Cancel an appointment by cancelId. Note only VA appointments can be cancelled online and some VA facilities do not support online cancellation. Only appointments that can be cancelled will have a cancelId.

parameters.description: The cancel ID hash from an appointment returned in the GET appointments endpoint.
parameters.name: cancelId

post.description: Check into an appointment.

get.description: Retrieves demographics confirmation information which includes a field indicating if insurance verification is needed, patient contact information, emergency contact information and next-of-kin contact information.

parameters.description: Unique location identifier
parameters.name: location_id

get.description: Checks if user is eligible to make an appointment with Community Care for a type of service. Checks if user is registered at a site that is marked as accepting community care requests and community care eligibility api says that they're eligible for the type of care they chose

parameters.description: Type of service to check eligibility for. Can only be one of following options primaryCare, nutrition, podiatry, optometry, audiology.
parameters.name: service_type

get.description: Checks if a list of facilities if they are eligible to create a appointment request to provide the given type of service at the facility.

parameters.description: Type of service to check eligibility for.

parameters.description: List of facility ids
parameters.name: FacilityIds[]

parameters.description: The page number requested. Defaults to 1.

parameters.description: The number of records to return per page. Defaults to 3.

parameters.description: The end date for the range of appointments slots in ISO 8601 UTC format. If not provided the end date will be 2 months from today's date

get.description: Returns a list of community care providers who provide the requested medical specialty within a certain radius of the user (default) or facility (if facility id is provided in query params).

parameters.description: The status of the report.

get.description: Returns the users prescriptions.

parameters.description: what field to sort array of prescriptions by. fields that can be sorted: prescription_id, refill_status, refill_submit_date, refill_date, facility_name, ordered_date, prescription_name, dispensed_date. date fields sort by DESC by default while all others default to ASC. To get the opposite sort direction negate the field with a '-'. EX: -prescription_id
parameters.name: sort

parameters.description: filter by field values. Syntax: ?filter[refill_status][eq]=refillinprocess. fields that can be filtered: prescription_id, refill_status, refill_submit_date, facility_name. eq can be switched out with not_eq. to filter by multiple values of the same field, deliminate the parameter value with commas. Syntax: ?filter[refill_status][eq]=refillinprocess,active
parameters.name: filter

parameters.description: The page number requested. Defaults to 1.
parameters.name: page[number]

get.description:
List messages in a secure messaging folder.

When listing messages, the response for each message will include most but not all of the message attributes.
Specifically, the message body and attachment information is not included. Those attributes can be obtained by
getting the specific message resource.

parameters.description: what field to sort array of messages by. fields that can be sorted:  sent_date, subject, sender_name, recipient_name. The date field sorts by descending order by default while all others default to ASC. To get the opposite sort direction negate the field with a '-'. EX: -recipient_name. Default sort field is sent_date.
parameters.name: sort

parameters.description: filter by field values. Syntax: ?filter[sender_name][eq]=JOHN DEER. fields that can be filtered: sent_date, subject, sender_name, recipient_name. Available operators include 'eq' and 'not_eq'. Date fields can use operators 'lteq' and 'gteq' (less/greater than or equal). string fields can use 'match' operator for partial matching. String fields can also be filtered by multiple values of the same field, deliminate the parameter value with commas. Syntax: ?filter[sender_name][eq]=John Deer,John Smith
parameters.name: filter

parameters.description: Whether or not to use this API's cache or fetch records from the upstream service. Defaults to true.
parameters.name: useCache

get.description: List of threads in a secure messaging folder

parameters.description: The id of the folder that threads are being retrieved from
parameters.name: folderId

parameters.description: The size of the pagination you want. Defaults to 10
parameters.name: pageSize,

parameters.description: The page number to get based on your page size
parameters.name: page,

parameters.description: The field to sort the results by
parameters.name: sortField,

parameters.description: The order to sort the results by
parameters.name: sortOrder,

post.description: Send a new secure message

message.description: Stringified JSON with same parameters as if this was an application/json request (e.g. '{'category":"OTHER","recipient_id":1763526,"body":"test message"}')

uploads[].description:
One or more message attachments. NOTES:
  • A single message may have a maximum of 4 attachments.
  • A single attachment cannot exceed 3 MB
  • All attachments combined cannot exceed 6 MB
  • Supported file types/extensions: doc, docx, gif, jpg, pdf, png, rtf, txt, xls, xlsx.

requestBody.description:
New message body. NOTES:
  • If a subject isn't included, default subject will be "{{Category}} Inquiry" (e.g. Medication Inquiry)
  • Messages can only be replied to for 120 days. After that, the message is considered "expired"
  • If sending a draft, include the draft's ID in the request body as `draft_id`. Draft will be deleted once sent. Any fields included in request body will overwrite original draft contents.
  • If including file attachments, this request must be sent as multipart/form-data
  • File attachment restrictions (as imposed by MHV):
    • User may attach up to 4 files
    • Accepted formats: doc, docx, jpg, pdf, png, rtf, txt, xls, xlsx
    • Single attachment cannot exceed 3 MB
    • Total attachment cannot exceed 6 MB

get.description: List available message categories
Gets user message signature preferences

delete.description: Moves a secure message to the "Deleted" folder

parameters.description: The id of the message that is to be deleted
parameters.name: id

get.description:
Get a secure message and mark the message as read. NOTES:
  • Unlike listing messages in a folder, the message resource returned from this operation will include the message body and attachment information.
  • This GET operation is not fully idempotent and will set readReceipt field as 'READ'
  • If message has an attachment included, attachmentSize is displayed in bytes

parameters.description: Whether or not to use this API's cache or fetch records from upstream when getting triage team information to determine if user is in triage team. See meta field 'user_in_triage_team'.
parameters.name: useCache

get.description: Get a secure message attachment content as a direct binary download. Secure messaging supports the following file types/extensions: doc, docx, gif, jpg, pdf, png, rtf, txt, xls, xlsx.

parameters.description: ID of the message that we are retrieving attachments of
parameters.name: id

Content-Disposition.description: This header will have the value of "attachment", and a "filename" parameter containing the original filename of the attached content.

post.description:
Send reply to a secure message NOTE: If including file attachments, this request must be sent as multipart/form-data File attachment restrictions (as imposed by MHV):
  • User may attach up to 4 files
  • Accepted formats: doc, docx, jpg, pdf, png, rtf, txt, xls, xlsx
  • Single attachment cannot exceed 3 MB
  • Total attachment cannot exceed 6 MB

parameters.description: ID of the message that is being replied to
parameters.name: id

message.description: Stringified JSON with same parameters as if this was an application/json request (e.g. '{"body":"test body with attachment"}')

uploads[].description:
One or more message attachments. NOTES:
  • A single message may have a maximum of 4 attachments.
  • A single attachment cannot exceed 3 MB
  • All attachments combined cannot exceed 6 MB
  • Supported file types/extensions: doc, docx, gif, jpg, pdf, png, rtf, txt, xls, xlsx.

get.description: Gets a list of message summaries that are related to the message of the passed id and older than the message of the id provided. Does not include the message of the passed id itself.

get.description: Downloads translations file.

parameters.description: When this endpoint responds with a 200, it includes a Content-Version header. The frontend is expected to store that value and include it as the `current_version` query param. When the `current_version` is omited or does not match the server's current version, the server responds with a 200 status, the newest version of the translations file, and the header including the newest version id. If the `current_version` matches the server's current version, the server responds with 204 and no content.
parameters.name: current_version

Content-Disposition.description: This header will have the value of "attachment", and a "filename" parameter containing the original filename of the attached content.

Content-Version.description: Current version of the file being downloaded.

get.description: Returns basic user information

requestBody.description: A domestic, internation, or military address

post.description: Creates a new residential or mailing address for a user. Calling this endpoint is the second step in adding a new address for a user. The first step is to call the address validation endpoint to check if an address is valid. If it is valid you'll receive a 'addressMetaData' object back with the addresses confidence score. This object should then be included along with the new address in the request body. If the user wishes to continue with an 'invalid' address then the 'validationKey' should be passed along with the new address in the request body. This lets the underlying service know that an invalid address be passed through.

requestBody.description: A domestic, internation, or military address

put.description: Updates a user's residential or mailing address. Calling this endpoint is the second step in adding a new address for a user. The first step is to call the address validation endpoint to check if an address is valid. If it is valid you'll receive a 'addressMetaData' object back with the addresses confidence score. This object should then be included along with the new address in the request body. If the user wishes to continue with an 'invalid' address then the 'validationKey' should be passed along with the new address in the request body. This lets the underlying service know that an invalid address be passed through.

requestBody.description: A domestic, internation, or military address

post.description: Validates a residential or mailing address for a user. Calling this endpoint is the first step in adding a new address for a user. If the address is valid you'll receive a 'addressMetaData' object back with the addresses confidence score. This object should then be included along with the new address in the request body. If the user wishes to continue with an 'invalid' address then the 'validationKey' should be passed along with the new address in the request body. This lets the underlying service know that an invalid address be passed through.

requestBody.description: A domestic, internation, or military address

Bearer.name: Authorization
Bearer.description: Authentication is via an access token returned from IAM's SSOe service. Pass the access token in the 'Authorization' Header in the format 'Bearer {accessToken}'. e.g. 'Bearer abcdefg1234567'.

InflectionHeader.name: X-Key-Inflection
InflectionHeader.description: Allows the API to return camelCase keys rather than snake_case

401.description: Authentication is possible but has failed or not yet been provided.

502.description: An upstream service the API depends on returned an error.

id.description: Upstream identifier. Same as id provided.

instructions.example: INJECT 1MG INTO THE MUSCLE WEEKLY FOR 30 DAYS

prescriptionStatusCount.description:
Count of different types of prescriptions. "active" contains prescriptions that have a `refillStatus` of active,
submitted, providerHold, activeParked, refillinprocess, and/or prescriptions that have a tracking number 
associated with them. If a prescriptions does not meet the criteria for "active", it appends it's `refillStatus` to the list. 
If a refillStatus is not present in any prescription, it will not be included in this list.
See `refillStatus` enum for all possible values. "isRefillable" is a separate count of prescriptions with `isRefillable` set to true. 
A prescription can be counted in both `isRefillable` and any other status count.

hasNonVaMeds.description:
Notifies if user has any prescriptions that are Non-VA (NV). This boolean will be set regardless of
the set of data returned in the "data" section of the response (ie. this will still be set to "true"
if the user has Non-VA meds but the current page of the response does not show any).

isOhMessage.description: Indicates if this message is an Oracle Health message

ohMigrationPhase.description: The Oracle Health migration phase for the facility associated with this message (p0-p7 or null)

messageCounts.description:
Count of read and unread messages. `readReceipt` field containing "READ" count towards "read" count 
while a null value will count towards "unread". If either read or unread is 0, the key will not be included.

isOhMessage.description: Indicates if this message thread is an Oracle Health message

recipient_id.description:
The message recipient. This must be a valid recipient id that is assigned to the user. The list of valid recipients for a user can be obtained from the 
/v0/messaging/health/recipients
endpoint.

category.description:
Message category. This must be one of the values returned by the 
/v0/messaging/health/messages/categories
endpoint.

body.example: What is the proper dosage and how long should I take this medication?

draft_id.description: Specifies draft message ID to send.  Draft message is deleted once sent. Note that the recipient_id, category, body, and subject included with this post will overwrite any of original values of the draft.

body.example:
Your prescription is ready for refill
Thanks,
,Dr. Doe

Your prescription is ready for refill
Thanks,
,Dr. Doe

ohMigrationPhase.description: The Oracle Health migration phase for the facility associated with this message (p0-p7 or null)

userInTriageTeam.description: This field is only present if the user is in the triage team for this message. This can be used to determine if the user can reply to the message.

body.example: Dear provider, please clarify my test results. Thank you.

draft_id.description: Specifies draft message ID to send.  Draft message is deleted once sent. Note that body included with this post will overwrite any of original values of the draft.

messageCounts.description:
Count of read and unread messages. `readReceipt` field containing "READ" count towards "read" count 
while a null value will count towards "unread". If either read or unread is 0, the key will not be included.

migrationDate.description: The date when the facilities are scheduled to migrate to Oracle Health.

facilities.description: A list of facilities migrating on the specified date.

facilityId.description: The unique identifier for the facility.

phases.description: Lists all the dates for each phase of the migration and shows the current phase for the migration

current.description: The current phase of the migration (e.g., "p1"), or null if no phase is currently active.

p0.description: The date when phase 0 begins (ISO 8601 date string).

p1.description: The date when phase 1 begins (ISO 8601 date string).

p2.description: The date when phase 2 begins (ISO 8601 date string).

p3.description: The date when phase 3 begins (ISO 8601 date string).

p7.description: The date when phase 7 begins (ISO 8601 date string).

notConfirmedReason.description: Displays the reason the veteran is not eligible for a status card

attributes.description: Displays data specific to either 'confirmed' or 'not confirmed' veteran status card

fullName.description: The concatenated full name of the veteran, displayed when eligible for a status card

disabilityRating.description: The disability rating for the veteran when eligible for a status card

latestService.description: The latest branch of service, begin date, and end date when the veteran is eligible for a status card

branch.description: The veteran's latest branch of service

beginDate.description: The start date of the veteran's latest service

endDate.description: The end date of the veteran's latest service

edipi.description: The user's EDIPI number when eligible for a veteran status card

header.description: Displays an error/warning title when the veteran is ineligible for a status card
header.example: You're not eligible for a Veteran Status Card

body.description: A list of message components to display when the veteran is ineligible for a status card

type.description: The type of message component - can be 'text', 'phone', or 'link'

value.description: The content to be displayed based on the data type
value.example: Your record is missing information about your service history or discharge status.

tty.description: An optional parameter when data type is 'phone' to signify TTY

url.description: When data type is 'link', this field contains the hyperlink

alertType.description: The type of alert - can either be 'error' or 'warning'
